com.yantra.ycp.japi

Interface YCPDynamicConditionEx


  • public interface YCPDynamicConditionEx
    This interface provides a mechanism to build complex logical conditions which can not be built by default condition builder. To add a new dynamic condition, create a class which implements this dynamic interface. When adding a condition to the repository using the configurator, mark it as dynamic and specify the implementation class.
    This interface is an enhancement to the YCPDynamicCondition interface. The signature for evaluateCondition in this interface is changed to accept Document as one of the parameters. Also a new method setProperties is provided which needs to be implemented as shown in the example below, in order to access any custom name/value pairs set during the configuration of the condition. These custom name/value pairs could be used in the evaluteCodition method to evaluate the condition.
    If Custom properties are not used for the dynamic conditon, then setProperties method can be defined as a no-op method, ie. public void setProperties(Map m){}

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean evaluateCondition(YFSEnvironment env, java.lang.String name, java.util.Map mapData, org.w3c.dom.Document doc)
      Implement this interface to create a dynamic condition.
      void setProperties(java.util.Map map) 

    • Method Detail

      • evaluateCondition

        boolean evaluateCondition(YFSEnvironment env,
                          java.lang.String name,
                          java.util.Map mapData,
                          org.w3c.dom.Document doc)
        Implement this interface to create a dynamic condition. If there is an exception, throw an instance of RuntimeException. env is the environment handle for the execution thread. Use this to call an API from this code. name is the name of the condition configured in the database. mapData contains the name-value pair of strings. Keys are same as the ConditionVariables passed to the pipeline. doc contains the transaction specific data available at the time of execution. return true if the condition is met, else return false. To utilize dynamic conditions, you must implement this interface.

        Example:
          import java.util.*;
  import com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSEnvironment;
  import com.yantra.yfc.dom.*;
  import org.w3c.dom.Document;
  public class TestDynamicCondition implements YCPDynamicConditionEx 
  {
      Properties _properties = new Properties();
        public boolean evaluateCondition(YFSEnvironment env, String name, Map mapData, Document doc) 
      {
                try 
          {
                                YFCDocument xml = YFCDocument.getDocumentFor(doc);
                                // For example, let us say, in this condition we are checking if value of the attribute "AttrName"
                                // under the root node is empty or not                  
                                String attrVal = xml.getDocumentElement().getAttribute("AttrName");
                
                                if (attrVal == null || attrVal.trim().length() == 0)
                                {
                                return false;
                                }
                                // the keys of mapData are the same as the variables available in condition builder
                                String enterpriseCode = (String)mapData.get("EnterpriseCode");
                                if (enterpriseCode.equalsIgnoreCase("Default"))
                                {
                                        if(_properties != null)
                                        {
                                Enumeration e = _properties.propertyNames();
                                while(e.hasMoreElements())
                                {
                                        String propName = (String)e.nextElement();
                                        System.out.println("Propery Name is: " + propName + " Value is: " + _properties.getProperty(name));
                                }
                                }
                                        return true;
                                }
                                return false;   
                }
                catch (Exception ex) 
          {
                        throw new RuntimeException("TestDynamicCondition failed due to ...");
                }
        }
        
                public void setProperties(Map map)
                {
                        if (map != null && !map.isEmpty())
                        {
                                _properties.putAll(map);
                        }
                }
  }

      • setProperties

        void setProperties(java.util.Map map)
